questions.question: What is a valid security concern with the user's access permissions to a website being stored in a cookie?
options: It is unsafe, the cookie should be stored in the HTTP response body.
It is unsafe, the cookie should be stored in the HTTP request body
[]The cookie can be modified directly from within the browser.
The cookie can be modified directly from within the web server

questions.question: What could be a reason that a user of a particular website keeps seeing the HTTP 503 error code being shown?
options: The user's browser has sent too many query parameters
The user's browser needs maintenance to update itself
[]The server is operating at or close to 100% capacity
The server encountered a runtime bug in its code

questions.question: Which is the most secure method to generate a CSRF token?
options: From a Pseudorandom Number Generator (PRNG) algorithm
[]From a True Random Number Generator (TRNG) source
From a randomly generated PHPSESSID value
From a system's timestamp in milliseconds

questions.question: Which HTTP method allows the user to upload large files, such as 2GB MP4 video files?
What is the most effective method to prevent SQLi attacks?
options: []Use prepared statement calls provided by the language/platform
Remove SQL keywords like INSERT and UPDATE
Replace each special character with a dot "." character
Strip all single-quote and double-quote characters

questions.question: What is the result of calling mysqli_real_escape_string() on this email address: peter o'leary@gmail.com?
Which statement correctly describes the code below? $keyword=$_GET['keyword']);
Where are persistent cookies located?
options: []A database file on the client browser
A configuration file on the client browser
A flat file record on the web server
A database table on the web server

questions.question: A URL shortener service such as http://bit.lyuses the following status code to send the user’s browser to the correct URL:
Some people with names like Bill O’Reilly may have problems with online transactions. Which type of code will remove certain characters from their names and cause such problems?

options: The database server is unable to scale horizontally
The database server is unable to scale vertically
[]The database server is located together with the application server
The database server is located outside of the application server

questions.question: What makes DOM-based XSS attacks more difficult to detect?
options: They make use of scripts stored in persistent storage
They steal the user’s session cookie and sends it to the attacker
[]They make use of scripts from unsanitized web server responses
They run on the browser to defeat server-based detection

questions.question: What happens when a cookie expires?
options: []It is removed directly from the browser’s memory and storage
It is removed directly from the server’s memory and storage
It is removed only after its timeout period on the server
It is removed only after a handshake between the browser and server

questions.question: Which Burp Suite mode systematically goes through payload lists in parallel (e.g., user1/pass1, user2/pass2, etc.)?
@`wotf file is used in HTTP Basic Authentication to store user login credentials?

options: Generate a new session ID on every page
Implement user-IP check on the client
Generate a new session ID on every login
[]Implement transport security check on the server

questions.question: Which types of attacks can be prevented by assigning a new session ID each time a user logs in?

options: The nonce is not included in the hash for all qop settings
[]The password is included in the hash for all qop settings
The cnonce is not included in the hash for all qop settings
The qop itself is not included in the hash even if qop=auth

questions.question: @`wotf is the most common secure authentication method used by online banking websites?
Which part of the HTTP protocol is used to set cookie information which is to be retained by the client's browser?
Which part of the web architecture ensures that HTTP session info can be restored upon a server crash?
Which is the best recommended time to generate a new session ID to guard against session fixation attacks?
options: Only after a successful user logout from the website
After any change is detected in the browser cookie
[]Before every user login to the website
Before every transaction request sent to the server

questions.question: Which attack method relies primarily on self-modifying code within a webpage using un-validated inputs?
What is the resulting number of output characters after a 9-character string is converted to Base64?
@`wotf HTTP authentication types should be the easiest for an attacker to attack?
A user needs to login securely. Which of these is NOT a secure method, and hence should NOT be recommended?
options: Site-to-site IPSEC VPN with AD integration

questions.question: During the HTTP Digest Authentication phase, which of the following will always be sent from the browser to the server?
options: []hashed username, password (and nonce, depending on algorithm)

questions.question: Which authentication method will cause the largest impact across multiple services worldwide when compromised?
Which is a valid domain setting for a cookie?
What HTTP status code will be received if the web application encounters an error resulting in a runtime exception?
Which enhancements to a form-based authentication web page will make it hardest for a hacker to attack?
options: []Switching to SSL/TLS on port 443 and adding 2FA
Adding a SHA1 hash to the password field while using 1FA
Setting the "secure" flag when creating the session cookie
Splitting the username and password fields into 2 web pages

questions.question:
@`wotf statements correctly describes the code below?
$st->bindParam(':userID', $userID);
What is a characteristic of the HTTP 302 redirect status which differs from HTTP 301?
options: []Indicates the redirect location may be changed
Indicates the redirect location must not be changed
Indicates browsers can update their bookmarks to the new location
Indicates browsers should show the home page if the redirect fails

questions.question: @`wotf statements about XML or HTML is correct?
options: In HTML, you can make use of arbitrary element names
In XML, you can repeat elements in an array, but not in HTML
[]In XML, you can define and use new attribute names as required
In HTML, you can nest elements of varying types, but not in XML

questions.question: Which is NOT a valid combination?
options: REST transaction with JSON request and JSON response
REST transaction with JSON request and XML response
SOAP transaction with XML request and XML response
[]SOAP transaction with XML request and JSON response

questions.question: Which part of the web architecture is responsible for creating the HTTP session?
Which is the best way to avoid session-sniffing attacks?
options: Set the cookie expiry timing to 43,200 minutes
Clear the session ID on every web page click

questions.question: What is Base64 used for, given that it is not able to encrypt data?
options: []To allow binary data to be transmitted in text format
To escape input fields within SQL statements
To transmit passwords and other sensitive information
To replace checksums and older hash algorithms

questions.question: How do DOM-based XSS attacks bypass detection by network security devices?
options: They can clear the session ID to erase the user's identity
They can logout the user before proceeding with the attack
They can send UDP instead of TCP web traffic
[]They can run on the browser without network communication

questions.question: What is an alternative way to store detailed user preferences for a website if a cookie is limited to only 4KB of data?
options: Store it in a persistent cookie
Store it in the browser's memory
Store it in the server's memory

questions.question: What happens in a session fixation attack?
options: The attacker guesses the victim's password using brute force
[]The victim uses a sesssion ID known to the attacker
The victim unknowingly sends the attacker his own session ID
The attacker sniffs the victim's session cookie

questions.question: What is the process for the server to verify that a CSRF token is valid?
options: []Checks its session token against the user token from the form
Checks its own server time against the time inside the user token
Checks the session ID decrypted using the user token from the form
Checks that the token matches the next generated random number

questions.question: Which is NOT a key characteristic of a Reflected XSS attack compared to a Persistent XSS attack?
options: Reflected XSS requires initial testing of the script code
[]Reflected XSS requires script code to be written to a database
Reflected XSS requires some form of social engineering
Reflected XSS requires a lack of validation in the website code

questions.question: @`wotf is supported by both XML and HTML?
options: Elements to describe arbitrary data structures

[]The client does not have a JavaScript execution engine

[]An object containing an object which is an array of 2 key/value pairs
